from_subsystem()[source]¶
class ground_engineering.ComponentModule(name: str, parent_subsystem: Module, component_state: type, average_power_consumption: float, health: ComponentHealth = ComponentHealth.NOMINAL, status: ComponentStatus = ComponentStatus.OFF, f_update: float = 1, n_timed_coroutines: int = 0)[source]¶

Bases: Module

async activate()[source]¶

Initiates any thread-sensitive or envent-loop sensitive variables to be used in this module.

async coroutines()[source]¶

Each component is in charge of the following routines:

1- Periodically monitoring its own state

2- Detecting critical states

3- Triggering failure states

4- Perform tasks being given to this component

5- Processes events from the environment that may affect this component

Component failure leads to no actions being able to be performed by this component. Subsystem-wide failure is to be handled by their parent subsystem.

async crit_monitor() → None[source]¶

Monitors component state after every component state update and communicates critical state to parent subsystem and other processes.

async environment_event_handler(event_broadcast: EnvironmentBroadcastMessage) → bool[source]¶

Affects the component depending on the type of event being received. Ignores all events by default.

async environment_event_processor()[source]¶

Processes any incoming events from the environment

async failure_monitor()[source]¶

Monitors component state and triggers failure event if a failure state is detected

async get_state()[source]¶

Returns a state class object capturing the current state of this component

async internal_message_handler(msg: InternalMessage)[source]¶

Processes messages being sent to this component. Only accepts task messages.

is_critical() → bool[source]¶

Returns true if the current state of the component is critical.

is_failed() → bool[source]¶

Returns true if the current state of the component is a failure state. By default it only considers power supply vs power consumption. Can be extended to add more functionality

is_power_supply_failure() → bool[source]¶

returns true if current state is a power supply failure state

async listen_for_abort(task: ComponentTask) → None[source]¶

Listens for any abort command targetted towards the task being performed. Any aborts targetted to other tasks are ignored but not discarded.

async maintenance_task_processor() → None[source]¶

Processes maintenance tasks in the order they are received.

async perform_maintenance_task(task: ComponentMaintenanceTask) → TaskStatus[source]¶

Performs a maintenance task given to this component. Rejects any tasks that is not intended to be performed by this component.

async perform_task(task: ComponentTask) → TaskStatus[source]¶

Performs a task given to this component. Rejects any tasks that is not intended to be performed by this component.

async periodic_update()[source]¶

Performs periodic update of the component’s state when the component is Enabled

async task_processor() → None[source]¶

Processes tasks in the order they are received. Listens for any abort commands that may be received during the performance of the task and processes them accordingly.

async update(crit_flag: bool = True)[source]¶

Updates the state of the component. Checks if component is currently in a critical state.

crit_flag:

when true, it flags a critical state from being flagged at the end of the state update. It is true by default.

async update_properties(dt)[source]¶

Updates the current state of the component given a time-step dt

async wait_for_failure() → None[source]¶

Counts down to the next predicted failure state of this component given that the current configuration is maintained

is_failed() → bool[source]¶

Returns true if the current state of the component is a failure state. By default it only considers power supply vs power consumption. Can be extended to add more functionality

async perform_task(task: ComponentTask) → TaskStatus[source]¶

Listens for any incoming transmissions. Needs to be told to start a ReceiveMessageTransmission task from its parent subsystem or CNDH subsystem at the beginning of the simulation otherwise all messages will not be received

class ground_engineering.ReceiverState(power_consumed: float, power_supplied: float, buffer_capacity: float, buffer_allocated: float, health: ComponentHealth, status: ComponentStatus)[source]¶

from_component()[source]¶

class ground_engineering.SubsystemModule(name: str, parent_platform_sim: Module, subsystem_state: type, health: ComponentHealth = ComponentHealth.NOMINAL, status: ComponentStatus = ComponentStatus.OFF, n_timed_coroutines: int = 0)[source]¶

Bases: Module

async activate()[source]¶

Initiates any thread-sensitive or envent-loop sensitive variables to be used in this module.

async coroutines()[source]¶

Each subsystem is in charge of the following routines:

1- Updating subsystem state using incoming component states

2- Updating knowledge of other subsystems’ states

3- Detecting critical states

4- Triggering failure states

5- Perform tasks being given to this component

6- Processes events from the environment that may affect this component

Subsystem failure leads to no actions being able to be performed by this subsystem. Agent-wide failure is to be handled by the platform simulator.

async crit_monitor() → None[source]¶

Monitors subsystem state and triggers critical event if a critical state is detected

async decompose_platform_task(task: PlatformTask) → list[source]¶

Decomposes a platform-level task and returns a list of subsystem-level tasks to be performed by this or other subsystems.

async decompose_subsystem_task(task: SubsystemTask) → list[source]¶

Decomposes a subsystem-level task and returns a list of component-level tasks to be performed by this subsystem.

async environment_event_handler(event_broadcast: EnvironmentBroadcastMessage) → bool[source]¶

Affects the component depending on the type of event being received. Forwards all events to all of this subsystem’s components by default.

async environment_event_processor()[source]¶

Processes any incoming events from the environment

async failure_monitor()[source]¶

Monitors subsystem state and triggers failure event if a failure state is detected

async get_state()[source]¶

Returns a state class object capturing the state of this subsystem

async internal_message_handler(msg: InternalMessage)[source]¶

Processes messages being sent to this subsystem.

is_component_critical() → bool[source]¶

Detects component-level critical state using latest component states received by this subsystem

is_component_failure() → bool[source]¶

Detects component-level failure state using latest component states received by this subsystem

is_subsystem_critical() → bool[source]¶

Detects subsystem-level critical state using latest component states received by this subsystem

is_subsystem_failure() → bool[source]¶

Detects subsystem-level failure state using latest component states received by this subsystem. By default it fails only if all components are in a failure state.

async listen_for_abort(task: Union[PlatformTask, SubsystemTask, ComponentTask]) → None[source]¶

Listens for any abort command targetted towards the task being performed. Any aborts targetted to other tasks are ignored but not discarded.

async perform_task(task: Union[PlatformTask, SubsystemTask, ComponentTask]) → TaskStatus[source]¶

Performs a task given to this subsystem. If the task is a subsystem-level task, it decomposes the task into a list of component tasks to be performed. Rejects any tasks if the subsystem is in a failure mode of if it is not intended for to be performed by this subsystem.

async subsystem_state_update_handler(subsystem_state)[source]¶

Reacts to other subsystem state updates.

async task_handler(task: Union[SubsystemTask, ComponentTask]) → None[source]¶

Handles component tasks to be performed by this subsystem’s components or subsystem tasks intended for other subsystems. Will abort any subsystem task submitted to itself to avoid locking.

async task_processor() → None[source]¶

Processes tasks in the order they are received. Listens for any abort commands that may be received during the performance of the task and processes them accordingly.

async update_component_state() → None[source]¶

Receives and processes incoming component state updates.

async update_subsytem_state() → None[source]¶

Receives state updates from other subsystems and reacts accordingly

class ground_engineering.SubsystemState(name: str, subsystem_type: type, component_states: dict, health: SubsystemHealth, status: SubsystemStatus)[source]¶

Bases: object
